title: Finding an Email Only Host
content: I am still paying for websites, just to keep my emails going but it sure is expensive with it being personal now. I don't store my emails with the current host, they just play middleman, receive the emails and ship them off to my Thunderbird. I store them on my computer and my external harddrive. Can you tell me how either I can host my own emails or a really reasonable priced email host? I don't want to loose these emails. The ones that mostly got used by the businesses have been dissolved. But the ones we are getting personal emails threw, we want to keep. Please advise.... thank you for your time and dedication to helping. Judi

title: ver 128 won't load because my laptop isn't compatable, Can I get an earlier version as a retro re-install?
content:
The new Ver 128 Thunderbird won't load and I keep getting error messages that it is not compatible with my computer. How can I get a retro download of an earlier version that does work?

I'm running a Toshiba _M780 laptop/tablet : 32 bit / x64-base with 4 Gb Ram ( 2.86 Gb usable) and Win 10 Pro 22H2 installed and KB5043131 currently downloading. I have 52.4 GB storage still available.

I had run a uninstall to clear a problem reported as "XPcom not loading" but when I went to do my re-install I kept getting V128 that just doesn't work.

Can I get access to either ver 115 or earlier that will work on my machine? I've had no direct email access for 8 days now and its getting critical. Perish the thought but I might have to go to Outlook!

help!

title: Delay between "deletes"
content: Within the last few days - which corresponds to Thunderbird asking me again to set up my gmail access - I've experienced delay deleting inbox emails. 3 to 4 seconds must elapse before deleting the next file, where I used to just hit "delete" as fast as I could. At the same time, Kaspersky has started to disengage, and other security glitches are popping up - related? Does anyone else experience this delay? Has code been introduced to deliberately slow down the delete process?

title: Aggiornamento del 25/26 settembre
content: DISASTRO ! dopo l'aggiornamento (automatico) effettuato stanotte, Thunderbird ha modificato autonomamente gli indirizzi pec dei mittenti sostituendoli tutti con l'ultimo che mi aveva scritto: sia in posta in arrivo che nell'archivio posa ricevuta adesso risulta che tutte le pec ricevute sono state inviate dallo stesso mittente !!! E' piuttosto grave come danno, mai successo con Thunderbird Sto seriamente valutando di cambiare programma di posta
creator: casellinox

title: InvalidParameter id
content:
Hi, saw this msg the first time yesterday. I am on Debian with Thunderbird 115.15.0 (64-bit)

I get this msg at startup: <yellow triangle with exclamation mark> Alert from account <existing account name written here>: <some code with letters, numbers, punctuation> InvalidParameter id: <same code again>_CFR_1

I don't know if the <same code again> is specific to my email account, so I did not write that here. Can't find any post on this InvalidParameter id.

I did not reconfigure that particular email account or changed any config in Thunderbird, besides what regular updates bring.

I have removed the email account from Thunderbird and reconfigured it, same msg. I could recreate the email account on the hosting side, but before I do that I wanted to see if there is more info about this problem, to avoid with other accounts in the future, maybe there is something preventive I can do ...

Thanks for any idea.
creator: panmeri

title: SMTP AUTENTICAZIONE MODERNA NON PRESENTE
content: Utilizzo Thunderbird versione 128.2.3esr (64 bit) per gestire la posta elettronica. Devo modificare l'autenticazione per un account Outlook: in entrata (POP3) ho selezionato il metodo di autenticazione moderna e funzione, ma per l'invio (SMTP) nella finestra di selezione il metodo di autenticazione moderna non c'è. Bisogna aspettare qualche aggiornamento? Saluti Filippo
creator: filippo.passeri
